newsitem.title: UK: UK Sumitomo investigation continues - SFO.
newsitem.headline: UK Sumitomo investigation continues - SFO.

text.p: Britain's Serious Fraud Office (SFO) said it continues its own inquiry into the copper scandal even though Sumitomo Corp said it had no evidence for complaint against foreign brokers or that the market was manipulated. "The investigation continues," said James O'Donoghue, head of information for the SFO. He added that his office has neither made any arrests nor filed any complaints.

Tokyo prosecutors said on Tuesday they arrested ex-Sumitomo star copper trader Yasuo Hamanaka on two counts of forging documents. But Sumitomo said it had found no evidence that he had manipulated the copper market, based in London.
"The Japanese investigation is obviously different from the SFO's investigation so our investigation continues as it has done," O'Donoghue said.
Asked whether Sumitomo's statements would make the SFO's investigation more difficult, he said, "I couldn't comment on that. I've not seen the information to indicate that."
The SFO had a good relationship with the Japanese officials and would continue to work with them, he added.
"We shall continue to liase closely with the Japanese authorities as we have done throughout."
It was impossible to say when the SFO investigation might be completed, O'Donoghue added.
